Reviews.Title: “Good Value,”
Reviews.Author: BigBAjax
Reviews.Content: The price was right, the location is convenient, close to downtown, restaurants and shopping. The staff were professional, polite and helpful. The room was clean, modern and very comfortable. I really enjoyed the full size pool and the overall atmosphere was pleasant. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: KennethOshawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: Just needed a staging base for a trip to Calgary. I found the staff at this hotel to be above & beyond the usual Hotel fare. They were honestly concerned with my comfort and went out of their way to make me feel at home. This hotel fit our budget & we intend to use their conference centre.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectation”
Reviews.Author: countrytraveller200
Reviews.Content: The place just exceeded my expectation. The lobby was great and spacious. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The pool was the highlight of the night as it was huge, and clean. My friends and I had a blast in the pool and Jacuzzi . Breakfast was good (danish, muffins, croissants, cereals, bread and bagels, orange, apples, milk, orange juice, apple juice). They don't have hot breakfast and which is not a big deal for me and my friends. Staff were very friendly and courteous. Requested for a microwave and refrigerator for 1 of the rooms and it was granted. The only negative thing I observed is, the elevator needs updating as there some scratches on the walls of the elevator. Other than that, I will be back again. Booked through Priceline and got a good deal $95.00 for 1 room, parking is $5.00 (includes breakfast for 2, breakfast for child is free as long as sharing room with adult) Note: if you bid your room at Priceline, breakfast is not included. Thank you to all the staff at days hotel. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel stay, customer service, amenities”
Reviews.Author: Toull K
Reviews.Content: My congratulation to the entire staff at Days In, we were delighted with the world class service, beautiful updated rooms, fantastic breakfast package and close to all amenities. As organizers we hosted a group of 30 folk dancers from Europe in October. Our guests were treated like royalty. All concerns and questions were addressed immediately. The fact that they were walking distance to a major mall and a hop step away from the major highways made their stay exceptionaly comfortable. Accommodations were made for the many costumes they brought with them. The staff and management helped me organize much of their travel and made suggestions to items I had not thought of. We now feel that any time we have guests our point of contact will be Days Inn. We did our research with all accommodations in the area, Days Inn surpassed all of them. I was given a tour of the full facilities with an understanding if I wanted to do a conference a banquet a dance or even business meeting, they would accomidate! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Leo B
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Days Inn for over two weeks I have been very happy with the staff and room. There have been many Hotels over the years that I have stayed in, 4 Star and better but I feel that Days Inn has taken care of my needs as well or better than most. Feel comfortable in staying here on your next trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “What service?”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelers100
Reviews.Content: The room was clean at first glance, then you wonder who has the long black hair? And why in my bathtub? The answer a slow drain. The Tub floor felt like water was in between the acrylic seal and the tub. The white glove treatment would not pass, just to naked eye. A small Continental Breakfast, better bring your favorite snack. Coffee/tea Maker, didn't work.however one cupper, so patience is a virtue! Fitness Centre, Sauna, Swimming pool all not clean, a cold walk from shower to pool that was freezing. And whats with the duct tape on pool?

Reviews.Title: “In need of a refresh”
Reviews.Author: Bzhpq
Reviews.Content: I went to this Days hotel as all other hotels in the area were booked. It looked nice from afar but close up you see that it is past its prime. You see that maintenance is not done at the level it used to. A lot of small repairs are not done, lights bulbs are missing from elevator buttons lights, so are screws from various panels here and there. Walls are scratched and need repainting. The pool has been repaired with a rubber membrane instead of fixing it properly. I never saw more than one person at the front desk. The restaurant (Fox & fiddle) was closed. It really has the feeling of a place about to close. On the bright side the room was clean (and it was the first time I didnâ€™t see a hotel directory of services in a room). The air conditioning unit in the room is quite noisy and the control minimalist. There is a OK breakfast buffet. There are quite a few good restaurants less than a 5 minutes drive away, as well as a large shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money IF you have a car”
Reviews.Author: Kitkatos123
Reviews.Content: Modern decor, very clean, good-sized rooms, very comfy beds and linens, friendly front desk staff, lots of free parking. It is at the top of the Don Valley at the 404/401 area, so very convenient to get places. There is a mall about a two-minute drive away for shopping and food (excellent Moxie's restaurant there). Free breakfast is only okay, toast/bagel/cold cereal. I wouldn't stay there without a vehicle, but the price was right, $107 CAA rate, for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat satisfied customer!”
Reviews.Author: carlitguy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times. The hotel has had a number of names including Ramada, Yorkland Hotel and I think there was another I can't remember. I am surprized by some reviews. The rate is around $100 which in Toronto is a bargain. I just don't understand some peoples expectations. Parking is $5 a night but this is a bargain compared to many hotels at $20 to 40 per night. The check in process is quick and the rooms are spotless. This trip we were there 3 times in 3 different rooms and we never had a single complaint. We stayed once on the highway side and twice on the street side. We had zero issues with noise. The Business Centre has free internet and even has one computer with a printer. That was a nice touch! The free breakfast in my opinion is of substantially higher quality than the continental breakfasts I have had elsewhere. A car is a necessity if you stay here nut there are a ton of restaurants within 5 minutes of the hotel and it is easy to access the Don Valley Parkway and both the 401 and 404 highways. Will I be staying there on my next trip? Absolutly. Dean in Canada

Reviews.Title: “Not At All”
Reviews.Author: Tammy G
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that things started out bad the minute we walked in...First of all when you get there you have to pay $5.00 per night per car to park there..You would think you could park there for free if you're paying to stay at their motel. We gave them our license plate number's 4 times before they finally finished asking us for it..Also when l called l asked for adjoining rooms as l had booked 2 as my family is large , l ended up getting rooms 3 doors away from each other..l might also ask ,why have a restaurant if its never open for business. We were told free internet..what internet..while we were there the internet wasn't even working. Don't get me started on the breakfast, it was terrible. It's supposed to be from 6-30am till 10am, well my family got down there at 8am and there was no coffee, no hot water for tea, and hardly any food left. ( although there really wasn't much to chose from). Some of the guests even left without waiting for their food as 2 pieces of bread took 4 minutes (yes a guest times it) to toast. Also second night we were there the toilet wouldn't flush. We called front desk and were told it couldn't be fixed till morning but we could be moved to another room. Well it was midnight and l wasn't about to wake up my kids and move them and everything we had at that time so l just hoped we wouldn't need to flush it till morning. l will say one thing though that my family and l did enjoy..the pool..although they really should put more than 1 change room in..if there was more than 1 person going into the pool you had to wait in line to take a shower..:( Would l stay at this motel again..NOOOOOO

Reviews.Title: “Typical Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: cuetxpie
Reviews.Content: Room #602. Got the 2 Queen Bed Room. Room is identical to the photos shown on their website. Bed is soft and clean. Flat screen Phlips television with cable access placed on one of the two desks. Desk chair is ergonomic. In addition, there is a soft chair with a swivel table attached to it, for when you want to throw up your feet but still want to get some work done. Sufficient closet space, along with plenty of drawers. Iron and ironing board available in the closet if needed. There is also a safe in the closet. There is a in room coffee machine. Typical restroom. Restroom amenities: tissue paper, hair dryer, lotion, shampoo, conditioner, and soap. Location: Next to the freeway. Business district, so dont expect to find anything around here after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to a suite ensured remainder of my 5-night stay”
Reviews.Author: kerewin39
Reviews.Content: Upon checkin, found the closet in standard room to be very small and drainage in shower to be very slow. After one night, requested front desk for another room, and as a result, was upgraded to an executive suite at the same rate for the remaining 5 nights of my stay. Enjoyed the remainder of my stay at Days Hotel. Pool and sauna are a good size.

Reviews.Title: “What a Joke”
Reviews.Author: R0gers1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok not as clean as I would like. I was very upset as all ads say there is a restaurant and yet it is shut down! There is no food close to this hotel so at night your stuck unless you have a car or are willing to have delivery from some place! Internet was shoddy and it was a roll of the dice if it worked which made it hard to complete my work. With no room service and not even a place to get a drink to unwind I was very unhappy with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed every minute of my stay.”
Reviews.Author: nic515
Reviews.Content: My room was always clean, and the staff was always accommodating for my full 9 days stay.

Reviews.Title: “Far from Toronto downtown, good hotel with all basic amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Backpacker_Chd
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 20 days during my business visit to Toronto, Canada. I chose this hotel because this hotel was quite close to my work place. But there is adirect connectivity to downtown via Subway. As a landmark, its very close to Fairview mall (Subway station also) in Toronto. This hotel has a nice indoor swimming pool, free high speed Wi-fi internet facility, microwave for every room and a very nice restaurant Fox and Fiddle in its premise.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, no surprises; a good bet for a business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Timothy_Adams
Reviews.Content: A couple of qualifiers first: I'm not as well-traveled as some who log on here, and wouldn't know a four star hotel from a two star hotel. I want a good night's rest in a secure, quiet environment, with no surprises and no bugs, and that's about all. And in that respect, the Yorkland Hotel -- now rechristened the 'Days Hotel & Conference Center,' as you can see by visiting http://www.dayshoteltoronto.com/ -- was just what the doctor ordered. If I return to Toronto, I'll come here. The room was quiet, bug free -- it passed my flashlight bed bug inspection -- and everything worked. Firm mattress. Warm enough, and that means a lot in Toronto in February. Friendly staff; I have fond memories for Evelyn and Viajay, although everyone there was quite nice. I asked for a fridge, and they brought me one without delay. A few mild caveats: Look at the map and you'll see that the Don Mills subway station is a short walk away. True, but a 'short walk' becomes twice as long when the terra firma is smothered in snow, as it's bound to be here in winter. You might want something closer to the subway station if visiting here in the snow-bound months. The breakfast is a bit on the spartan side. Just a bit. Depends on what you expect. This hotel may not have bed bugs, but I think all hotels should invest in mattress encasements, given the threat bed bugs pose to travelers. What's it gonna cost? $50 wholesale per bed? And my biggest, perhaps most unreasonable beef: I had to lug my clothes in the freezing weather to this laundromat -- http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=105+Parkway+Forest+Drive,+Toronto,+Ontario,+Canada&aq=0&sll=43.773904,-79.341212&sspn=0.006988,0.015074&ie=UTF8&hq=&hnear=105+Parkway+Forest+Dr,+Toronto,+Toronto+Division,+Ontario+M2J+1P5,+Canada&z=17 -- because the hotel laundry service wants something like $6 to wash my blue jeans. Maybe that's typical, but no thanks. I don't mind paying a premium. The hotel could install washer/driers that go for, say, $5 a load. That would be a mild rip off, but I'd pay it rather than hike through the snow. I *won't* pay $6 just to get a pair of jeans washed. Next to last thoughts: this hotel seems to be a popular conference center in the Toronto area. If you pass a full parking lot, it's likely because a conference is in process. This had no negative effect on me as a guest. Last thoughts: I think this has to be an almost ideal bet for the business traveler. The wifi works, there's a safe in the room big enough for a laptop, and even a gym, to keep your muscle tone up. But party-seeking youth should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: irlundee
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of beaming reviews mostly bases on "wow 4 star at this price" but the problem is this isn't a true 4 star. Room is spacious and renovated, bathroom standard not 4 star, staff robotic, breakfast impossible to be 4 star. Bottomline hotel is okay but you can stay in 3 star hotels that are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Second time we stayed here - will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: carlitguy
Reviews.Content: At this price point it is hard to beat this hotel. We stayed here last year and will stay again. You should see what else is out there for this kind of money (under $100) if you shop. Best of all it includes a breakfast with juice, yogurt, milk, teas, coffee, cereal, full fresh fruit, toast, jam sweet breads and jams. Our room was clean and we had a small issue with the thermostat but it was our fault not theirs. They dealt with it promptly. The room was clean and hving developed a very serious medical emergency the front desk staff moved us away farom most of the other guests as I had to spend three days in bed. There is free internet, a pool and newspapers. I look forward to staying here again next trip. The only issue it is not convenient if you don't have a car. It is on a bus route though Dean in Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunner06
Reviews.Content: Quiet, large clean room, King sized bed, great night sleep, breakfast included, staff very helpful and polite, parking is only $5 a night in a huge safe parking lot.. have a great restaurant, cheap pints of premium beer, great food (highly recommend the happy hour appetizers, HUGE portions, perfect before the marathon we ran) would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto Getaway '10”
Reviews.Author: dadivitan
Reviews.Content: Service was great; couldn't ask for more. Daily breakfast was superb; we just loved the croissant. Coffee seemed to have an aroma different from the ordinary brew. Room had enough space to move around. We loved the king-sized bed; lots of room to stretch our tired bodies, considering we flew in from California. Bathroom space is quite limited. Hotel location is very accessible to and from the airport, shopping centers, and Niagara Falls. The trip to Niagara enabled us to view the countryside. Lest we forget, your front desk staff are very friendly, courteous, and accommodating from the very day we checked-in until we check-out . We take off our hats to Frances, and Chris for a job well done. Keep up the good work! Yorkland Hotel is very lucky to have staff like you.

Reviews.Title: “Not so pleased”
Reviews.Author: helooo99
Reviews.Content: This place was so busy at times I just wanted to scream watch your children please. Wasn't so impressed with the room, just looked dirty and the sink was. No blowdryer in the washroom???? Breakfast in the morning was watery coffee bruised apples and picked through pastries. I recommed Tim Hortons around the corner. The alarm was set for 7am and was woken from that. That is something that staff should be checking as they clean the room. I was pissed.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing”
Reviews.Author: merlitoconcepcion
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay and we would like to give credit to one particular employee who have gone out of her way to just accommodated us and made our stay enjoyable and her name is Francis.

Reviews.Title: “decent place great staff”
Reviews.Author: sadexx
Reviews.Content: I had a good stay here the staff were great also nice food in hotel bar.

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY THE MOST AWSOME STAY*THEY MADE OUR WEEKEND!”
Reviews.Author: kramerlover
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, total 5 star service and we enjoyed every minute we were there. We had a rough start by staying at another crappy hotel and decided we needed to leave. We booked the yorkland through hotwire and when we got there, we were completly exhausted from not being able to sleep in the other slump so they let us have an early check in and a late check out! We will absolutely be repeats! Thanks again, Lea

Reviews.Title: “worse experience”
Reviews.Author: doesheh
Reviews.Content: Horrible smell, stained carpets, dirty everywhere. Rude front desk. They advertise the "Toronto's new four star Hotel". It's a joke. Breakfast was free and everything was stale. I didn't like the hotel from the entrance to the exit. To top it off, as I was having breakfast a mouse ran across the cafe. When I told the front desk she was very non responsive...maybe not the first time she's heard it. I dont' mind a simple place but it should have some basic qualities...clean, no smells, good food, nice people, and fresh food....we should have spent a few more dollars in gone somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS! DISGUSTING HOTEL AND HORRIBLE SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: s_vendi
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel at all costs, like you would avoid a diseased animal. The worst hotel I have ever placed foot in. My girlfriend and I wanted to stay here for a weekend together and it was the worst decision ever made! When we got there the staff at first seemed pleasant and things seemed ok. After we got on our floor, there were dirty dishes left at the doors of other rooms. I found this odd because I had read this in a different review about this hotel; so I was ready for this but still found it odd that their cleaning service didn't do their job. Might I add we checked in around 7/8PM, so for sure they had finished with their cleaning service for the day and there was no way those dishes were getting picked up. When we got in our room, it seemed nice and clean. Looked like your average hotel. We relaxed and lounged around a bit. When we were finally going to bed it was around 11PM and we had already been napping for a little bit by this point. I got up to get something and turned on a light. I noticed there was a bug, a small bug, on my girlfriends pillow. At first I thought it was a bug that came from outside or something so I just killed it. As soon as I looked up though, they were all over the walls behind the bed; crawling everywhere. On the backboard, the wall behind it, the bottom of the bed; it was DISGUSTING. I will never forget that image and how much it makes me cringe every time, I cannot tell you. We immediately packed our things and told them the story and asked for a new room. The guy at the front desk (who was interestingly enough the same guy who greeted us in a friendly manner when we first got there), he immediately changed his attitude. He acted all snobby and rude and said 'i want to see these bugs', and immediately left. Of course when he returned he was apologetic because he found them. They gave us a new room and when we got there the card didn't work for the room. We decided we didn't even want to stay there anymore. We told them we wanted our money back, which was a big hassle in itself (and which we haven't received everything yet; they owe us like another 50 bucks or something still). But we decided to stay at a different hotel, the Delta Markham, which might I add was amazing. We told them our story and they accommodated us well. But I will never step foot in the Yorkland Hotel to even use their washrooms! And if you value your health and a half-decent service, you will avoid this hell hole at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “They have attempted to renovate the rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Visiting22
Reviews.Content: They have attempted to renovate the rooms but it wasn't a complete success. The hall ways smell and carpets in the hall need overhaul. The doors to the room shuts automatically but with a such a loud bang that you'd think a bomb was going off. Your girlfriend nor your wife will appreciate this place. Only if you are having guys night out and need a place for the guys. Rooms have been renovated so it's sort of ok but you can see that finishes to the wall and floor in the bathroom were done poorly.

Reviews.Title: “The worst service i have ever had”
Reviews.Author: nestea0101
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room for my partner and i, we got there at 3:12 and they told us we were 12 minutes late even though we were not told that we had to be there for 3:00. They took away the room we had already paid for, took our deposit and also left us with a small room with one bed even though we had paid for a bedroom with a living room and a little bar in our room. They then tried to tell us that we had to pay an extra $100 just to get a half decent room although not the same room we wanted. Overall it was the worst experience and i would NEVER ever in my life recommend this hotel to even my worst enemies.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel but not the best”
Reviews.Author: HEMA93
Reviews.Content: we bought a ontario science package stay for 4 with breakfast inc. Over all the hotel was clean and smelled nice.. Outside front lobby was broken glass and litter. the pool was nice and big. the changeroom shower was broken for both the mens and ladies shower, also the curtain fell down in the shower. This was annoying to shower, the water went everywhere. Our room had 2 comfortable queen beds, 30 inch tv, internet? was too weak to get a signal. The room ac/fan heater was very loud, we couldn't have it on while we were sleeping. The continental breakfast was a joke!!!!!!!!ONLY BREADS and muffins and pastries. No weight watching here. The PLATES are kept in a COOLER and are VERY COLD, CUTLERY TOO. No hot chocolate, NO CEREAL, NO PEANUT BUTTER., the coffee was weak. Not much to have for breakfast. The tea was OK. My suggestion is to drive to TIM HORTONS or some where else like the person I met in the elevator, holding breakfast from TIM HORTONs. the bad thing was his breakfast was NOT for sale!!. The tickets inc. for the package of this hotel DOES NOT INCLUDE THE BODY WORLDS EXHIBIT. PLEASE BE ADVISED WHEN BOOKING PACKAGE FOR ONT. SCIENCE CENTER. I forgot to mention that through the night it was very noisy, doors shutting, banging on the walls, just very loud and disrupting during the night. I did not get a good night sleep. MY FAMILY DID NOT LIKE THE OVERALL THE EXPIERENCE except for the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Our Fabulous WEDDING!!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole011
Reviews.Content: Our wedding at the Yorkland Hotel was beyond wonderful. The food was to die for! The Banquet manager was so accomodating that we can't thank him enough. The Garden was beautiful, and the servers were both discreet AND friendly...odd combination, you'd think, but they did a really good job. The Fox and Fiddle is also inside there, and they were more than great with our large "Rehearsal" dinner the night before. The rooms were spectacular, especially the Suite. I would reccommend this hotel for a group function a thousand times over. The "Yorkland" ballroom is beautiful. The hotel is also known as the Wyndham Garden, but is in the middle of changing names. But its so conveniently located at 404 and 401 that you can't go wrong here. Again, Food....TOPS, the Rooms, excellent, the service ABOVE AND BEYOND.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: Laurie3950
Reviews.Content: Hotel is newly renovated and looks great. Rooms were spacious and clean. I booked directly wih the hotel and received a much better deal then anything I could find online. Breakfast is included with the price and it was nice to be able to just go up and help yourself. Toast, pasteries, muffins, fruit, yogurt, cereal, coffee, tea and hot cocoa. Front desk staff were very pleasant as were any other staff members I happened to come in contact with. Beds are comfy and the bedding was extremely comfy. I did find it odd they charge for parking in the location they are in. Close to transportation and lots of shopping. Also has very easy access to the highways.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, small bathroom, great pub, terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Luke911
Reviews.Content: Went there for a friend's wedding, all the wedding party and family were staying at the same hotel and on the same floor,that was really nice . The room itself was ok, lack a little bit of warmth but the bed was comfortable and the appliances were ok. Bathroom was a little small and there was a huge problem with the vent system. The staf was very friendly and helpful. Te pub in the lobby serves GREAT pub food ( must try the chicken wings and fish and chips) be careful because everything is deep fried so if you're watching your health and calories....not so good ( there were some salads but did not get to try them. One little thing is they don't serve strong cider...or any cider... Location itself is not close to downtown but since i did not get to visit and was here for a specific purpose, it reall did not matter Now the real cons: The bathroom air vent system is down or weak ( confirmed by staff)...not to get into details but let say it's not pleasant when you have a residual smell that stays in the room through your whole stay ( unless you can control your fibers :)) They handle you breakfast coupons....we went the 1st day and passed the 2nd day, crowded, noisy, really nothing fresh as food, industrial danishes, process cheese...ec etc. All in all we liked our stay since we were with a group of friend, not so sure I'll make this my favourite destination in TO but will repeat if I have to stay in the area

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Content: During my stay for only 1 night was very, very good. When i went in there was no smell. The beds were very comfy and it came with a very nice plasma 42" television! The floor was a non - dirty one and the inside and outside in my opion was very safe and secure. It had very nice space and a nice chair. The air conditioning work perfectly. The bathroom was clean with towels ready. It came with shampoo, soap and a nice cleaned floor. My whole family liked it as one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. Even though the breakfast room was kind of small, the food was great and fresh. The front desk were very nice. Overall i think this hotel is great and recommend it for others.

Reviews.Title: “clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: palmer6509
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. I loved the fact that a non-smoking room was guaranteed to be a non-smoking room. We stayed at the Hilton last year and were given a smoking room when I had booked 2 weeks in advance for a non-smoking room. This hotel was just as fresh and clean, all the staff were MUCH friendlier and remembered my name whenever they saw me. The pool was actually larger than I expected. It was also very clean. It is still under renovations in some areas but it didn't affect us in any way.

Reviews.Title: “WORST, DIRTIEST, SMELLIEST HOTEL EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: sairahoney
Reviews.Content: This hotel spoilt my whole trip, power was out the second night i was tehre, there was stains on walls, wrinkeled sheets, garbage still in the trash can of hotel, unclean toilets, breakfast had a hair on it. A total let down, I cut my trip short due to the conditons on the hotel and changed as soon as I could!!

Reviews.Title: “Lacking finishing touches”
Reviews.Author: unkn0wn1
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at The Yorkland for two nights. I was very pleased with the front desk and the staff at the Yorkland. The small things are what separate the good from the mediocre. The Yorkland is unfortunately in need of a few finishing touches before it would achieve a ' very good ' rating with me. The bathrooms are very small, have no fans and the acrylic bathtub fitted liner was poorly installed causing the tub to be spongy and uneven to stand in, very dangerous. The heating/ac unit was loud. The pictures on the walls were way too small and looked cheep. The buttons in the elevator were the clear type with the floor number written in it, but the clear plastic was very old dinghy and dirty. The continental breakfast was very limited. Donâ€™t expect much. There is a $5.00 per night parking fee that is an obvious rip off. The swimming pool liner was not properly installed causing major ripples in the liner, very unprofessional. The pool liner also showed signs of poor maintenance with what looked like a three-inch soap scum ring around the top. Even though I paid $ 47 per night through Hotwire (I searched the Don Valley / Toronto area) that doesn't make it a good deal in general, just that I paid a reasonable rate for a nights stay. I was hoping to get a great rate on a great hotel. Isn't that the point of searching for a great rate? Will I recommend this hotel? Unsure, it depends what your needs are. I paid a reasonable rate for this hotel; I wouldn't suggest you pay more than $ 60 tops. There are several other hotels that you may pay a little more for, but you will get way more for your money. I hope this helps. Also, be sure if you stay to insist on a room facing the front of the hotel, the back rooms faces a very busy and loud highway. We were lucky!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Go2Girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham Garden Toronto from February 19-20, 2009 on business. The hotel is located somewhat in the middle of nowhere (near the junction of the 401 and the Don Valley Parkway), from the perspective of a visitor to the city at least. However, from the moment I arrived, I was impressed. The front desk staff was incredibly efficient and courteous, which started my staff off right. I was assigned to Rm. 834. It was large, comfortable and tastefully decorated. A King-sized bed and a flat screened television featured prominently in the room, as well as a comfortable chair and an expansive desk for those who need to work during their stay. The entire hotel has been recently renovated and it shows. The lobby is the highlight of the space, full of comfortable seating areas and brightly lit. If I were ever back in this part of town (though I wonder why I ever would be), I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A sports-weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: clamc40
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults, 2 children aged 9 + 12) stayed here in December 2008 as part of a larger group of families (our son's sporting team). Normally expectations aren't huge when traveling with a sport team, however the Wyndham was quite good. Our travel coordinator received a great rate ($99) and the reservation, check-in, and check-out process was smooth and easy. Good things about the room - it was fairly large which was good as we travel with a family and lots of "stuff", the beds were comfortable, and the room was set up perfectly fine for laptop and technology work (lots of plugs, easy to access wireless internet). That is a real MUST for us. The bathroom and the closet were tiny, though. Not a big issue, however. One thing I did notice is that dirty wineglasses sat outside another room in our hallway for 2 entire days .. morning, day, and night ... they just sat there in that hallway, never picked up. I noticed them when we got there on Friday night, and they were still sitting there when we left on Sunday. Strange that housekeeping never picked them up over that whole time and makes me wonder how many other housekeeping corners they cut. However, that being said, we had a good stay there. The hot tub was out of service when we were there, but the boys enjoyed the pool area - it was bright and clean and a pleasant environment, while not a huge pool. It is pretty convient to find although in some respects it feels out of the way because it is in this industrial-park type of area. Although once you know where you are going it turns out to be quite convenient. Few helpful places down the street (Starbucks!). Absolutely need a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay, the pictures are the real thing.”
Reviews.Author: celicagts7
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights, and the place was true to the pictures I saw on Expedia's website, the room was very nice, very nice finishings. The bathroom was a little small but how much time do you spend in there. The bed was very comfortable and nice flat screen tv. Granite coountertops and nice bedding, hottub and pool were very nice, staff was excellent, no comlpaints about them. But if you want a watch a movie stay away from what they call smoovies, it is $10 a day and you can watch up to 5 movies, the problem is, I have never heard of most of the movies and they were all very old.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely updated, far from town thou”
Reviews.Author: slimshaneylondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night as I had a business meeting near to the hotel. It is a little difficult getting here by public transport from Toronto airport. I took 3 trains & a bus & still could not find it. The location is not good if you are visiting downtown, its far out. At night, it is hard to find this hotel. I had to flag a taxi down & he took me the short distance. The hotel seems to have undergone transformation recently. Newly decorated rooms are very nice, thou the lighting at night is very poor. Nice flat screen tvs with vast amounts of channels. Staff are very friendly. Great hotel but not for those looking to be near downtown or the airport.

Reviews.Title: “So So Hotel - 3 stars max”
Reviews.Author: SpeedyG-7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for almost 2 weeks for work. Rooms were refurbished and mostly OK. Elevators need updating. Pool and gym were good. Breakfast buffet was limited and had the same items during my entire stay. Location is relatively good, if you don't need or want to be downtown, as it is near 401 and 404 freeways. Front desk very friendly. 2 things I really didn't like were 1) The extremely poor lighting in the room. At night, there is not enough light in the room to read or do any work. I called the front desk and there was nothing they could do. 2) Room doors close very loudly unless other guests are very careful. If you are a light sleeper, this will definitely wake you up.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated”
Reviews.Author: muffin78
Reviews.Content: Thankfully, this hotel has FINALLY been renovated (for the most part). This place was a dump for years, with decor straight out of 1975. Lobby, restaurant, conference facilities, and bedrooms have all been redone in a sleek, modern style. Overall, a decent hotel for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: jockster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the wyndham for 3 nights in early sep 08. First off, it's not handy or convienent if you plan to tour the city as it's over 20kms outside! As it's located near highway 401 the rooms at the back of the hotel are quite noisy, so i'd recommend asking for a room at the front of hotel. Staff are extremely helpfull, particularily at the on-site restaurant/bar who went out of their way to get us information on live music venues. Good food and drink to be had there too. Parts of the hotel were recently renovated and while our room was generally fine, more attention to detail is needed, like the mucky looking elevator mentioned before. We had out-dated switchs in the bathroom, and no ventiation which is ridiculous. One other thing that bothered me was the condition of the toilet in the lobby. The paper towel dipenser was hanging open with towels hanging out and used towels all over the floor. Not a bad place generally, but too far away from toronto centre for serious touring!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: JR20-Montreal
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel on a weekend visit to Toronto. Great location as it's right at the 401 and 404. Easy to get everywhere in the city. I stayed at the hotel in the past when it was the Ramada and the renovations and re-branding have made it a whole new experience. The staff and service was excellent. The rooms are clean and modern and the lobby is beautiful. It recently changed the restaurant to a chain restaurant. The prices are more reasonable and the food tasty. I highly recommend the Wydham Garden Inn Toronto for family weekend stays or for business.

Reviews.Title: “June 25, 2008”
Reviews.Author: Jerseygirl924
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a business park just off of 401 & 404, and an easy drive to the Toronto Zoo. The rooms were very stylish but small. The bedding was very plush but the mattress could have been a little softer. The bathroom was too small, and had no ventilation fan. The indoor pool area is very clean and nice but empty. The hotel mainly caters to business travelers, so not many kids were around. Also, the cafe restaurant was just for a quick breakfast. Overall, not a bad hotel, just not suitable for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “VERY ENJOYABLE STAY”
Reviews.Author: yllom40
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We booked a suite. Room was clean, quiet staff was very friendly. We ate breakfast there every morning, the prices were average and we were given a lot of food. I recommend the continental. breakfast. Location is about a 20 minute drive from downtown, which was conveniet if you don't want to be right downtown

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Dwntime
Reviews.Content: I found the Wyndham hotel by chance, just surfing trip advisor for a place to stay while we went to Canada's Wonderland. I booked the site through the Wyndham directory, booked and paid in advance to I saved some money, about 14.00 per nite savings. The hotel is located right next to the 404, so pretty easy to get to the 401 or 407, it is kind of back of the main street, so the location was good. The staff at the reception guest were very nice, greeted us with a big smile, and were very welcoming. The Lobby is clean and modern. Once we got our room card we headed up, stayed on the 8th floor, walked in and we were pleasantly surprised, the room smelled good, just a note that this is a non-smoking hotel, so no old smoke smell anywhere which is always good. The room is decorated nicely, a huge 32 inch flat screen, and a massive king size bed, ok this bed was awesome, I dont think my wife and I have ever slept so good. It was so comfortable, you didnt want to get out, so huge marks for the comfort there. The bathroom is small but very clean, a shower that at times seemed to go cold on you for a brief second, but no biggy. They are working on some new movie program for the hotel, so we just had regular tv for our stay. Ok now here comes the bad part, my wife was hungry so she decided to order from the hotel restaraunt ( Synergy ), a cheeseburger and fries will cost you about 13.00 dollars (ouch) but she ordered it anyway. This was by far the worst burger I have ever seen or tasted, I am not sure what kind of meat was in there but it was just horrible. We are not ones to complain, but we called down to Synergy and told them this, they did take the burger off the bill, I am thinking we both ended up with a stomache ache after just having a bite of this thing. So We didnt eat anything else from there, so I would avoid Synergy, very expensive, and from what we saw very poor quality. The pool area is very nice, has a hot tub and a large pool, very clean, and enjoyed that very much. The best part about the hotel would be the staff, and the price, very reasonable for what you get. Just dont eat there !

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Renovated”
Reviews.Author: Busy_business
Reviews.Content: This hotel has recently been converted from a Ramada Inn to a Wyndham Garden Hotel. I often use this faciltiy when I take business trips as it is easily accessible from the 401. I must first say that I stayed in this hotel prior to the renovations and brand switch. It was old and dingy to say the very least. The new renovations have breathed new life into this facility. Now that the renovations are nearly complete I am confident that others will see the difference in the customer service as well as the overall appearance. I look forward to future stays!

HotelInfo.Name: Days Hotel & Conference Centre - Toronto Don Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 185 Yorkland Blvd, Toronto, Ontario M2J 4R2, Canada (Formerly Yorkland Hotel Toronto)
